page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY III
page.content:
Most of the houses in Cummertrees are traditional cottages, but on the outskirts ,there starts an unusual terrace of houses, which are 3 storeys high,called Queensberry Terrace,built by General Edward Brooke of Kinmount. Across the road from these is a war time shelter,built for the tenants of the terrace.
POWFOOT In the 1790s, Powfoot was a hamlet of fisherman's houses ( which still remain and are called 'White Row'). There was also a harbour from which grain was shipped. This came from all the surrounding farms. Powfoot was then also a fishing harbour.There were houses on either side of the Pow.The house now called Bridge Cottage was where the grain was stored before being shipped out.
